37.10.3.2.2.1.3 Enabling condition after aborted diagnosis
In the case of a diagnosis abort (see hierarchy DiagBrk) the bit L V_DIAGCPS_INTRis set. In the case of a
renewed veri?cation of the enable conditions, the bit set has as a consequence that the timer Timer_1_u16_
0p02 is is reset and started once wih the waiting time C_T_DL Y_ENA_DIAGCPS_AFT_INTR_0. The waiting time
(C_T_DL Y_ENA_DIAGCPS_AFT_INTR_0) is speci?ed in the sub-hierarchy (tiDlyAftBrk). The bit L V_DIAGCPS_INTR
is subsequently reset. As long as the active timer decrements the waiting time, the bit L V_DL Y_ENA_DIAGCPS_
AFT_INTR remains set and hinders thus the enabling of the diagnosis.

37.10.3.2.2.1.3.1 Waiting time after aborted diagnosis
The waiting time after an aborted diagnosis is selected according to the different ambient temperatures. The
fuel dampens strongly in the warmth and the oily damp frequently leads to the diagnosis abort and therefore
a suf?cient cleaning time must be ensured before the next diagnosis begins. Considering the above, different
waiting times are foreseen according to different ambient temperatures.

37.10.3.2.3 Overview of the diagnosis state active
In the state diagnosis "active" the abort conditions are veri?ed ?rst. If an abort of the diagnosis is not nec-
essary, the state machine for the stimulation of the CPS is calculated. Most of the abort conditions are
summarized in the hierarchy DiagBrk. The following abort criteria apply:
? Engine rpm, relative air charging or measured manifold air pressure not in the allowed range ( L V_DI-
AGCPS_GRD_OK false)
? The oscillations of the engine rpm or of the measured manifold air pressure are too high (L V_DIAGCPS_
RNG_OK false)
? Plausibility check of the diagnosis result negative (L V_DIAGCPS_CNLtrue)
? Change of the engine operation (half mode)
File: MCB00R02.00C
10611Project: VW SIMOS 18.1 EA888 Document key: 10213413 SPE 000 DE

expressed authorisation are prohibited. Offenders will be held liable for payment of damages. All rights created by patent grant or registration of a utility model or design patent are reserved.
EVAM, Functional check canister purge solenoid
If the abort criteria do not occur, the diagnosis is continued meaning that the subordinate state machine for
the stimulation of the CPS (hierarchy StiPurgeVlv) is executed.
The abort criteria LV_DIAGCPS_GRD_OKand LV_DIAGCPS_RNG_OK(hierarchy DiagBrk) are calculated only,
when the diagnosis is in state "active".
When leaving the state of the diagnosis "active" the instructions in the hierarchy
EndDiagAcv are executed. The state change can have the following causes:
? The diagnosis was aborted
? The diagnosis was executed successfully
? The function-internal error memory shall be erased
? One and only one intake point of the CPS was checked (optional)
If the following conditions are ful?lled abort condition (L V_DIAGCPS_INTR), condition for ending the diagnosis
(L V_END_DIAGCPS) or condition for erasing the error memory, the diagnosis will leave the state "active".
As long as the diagnosis was carried out in one and only one CPS path, the diagnosis leaves the state "active"
and goes back to "Standby", in order to diagnose the other intake point.

37.10.3.2.3.1 Conditions for aborting the diagnosis
The following abort criteria are only checked in case the diagnosis is active (STATE_DIAGCPS = 2):
? Engine rpm within the allowed range
? Relative air charging higher than the rpm-dependent threshold
? Differential pressure (ambient ? intake manifold) higher than the rpm-dependent threshold
? Engine rpm dynamics within the allowed range
? Dynamics of the modeled manifold air pressure within an allowed range (threshold depending on the
calculated CPS actuation amplitude for executing the diagnosis)

relative air charging and for the dynamics of the modeled manifold air pressure.

37.10.3.2.3.2 Overview of the subordinate state machine for stimulation of the CPS
The state machine for the stimulation of the CPS is subordinated to the state machine for the diagnosis. As
soon as the diagnosis changes in the state "active", in the subordinate state machine the state "StiIni" becomes
active. In this state, initializations are carried out and it is waited until an external function has deactivated the
CPS. The function waits subsequently for an applicable time before a transition to "StiAcv" takes place.
In the state ?StiAcv", the CPS is stimulated with a calculated pattern, the effects of the stimulation are collected
by means of the differential pressure and a diagnosis result is calculated when the diagnosis is ?nalized. If the
diagnosis result shall not pass the plausibility check, the bit LV_DIAGCPS_CNL is set. The successful conclusion
of the diagnosis is indicated by the bit L V_END_DIAGCPS.

37.10.3.2.3.2.1 Initialization phase, control amplitude and expected value
In the beginning the bit L V_DIAGCPS_RUNis set to true. By setting the bit, an external function is instructed to
deactivate the CPS as long as this has not already been done by controlling the scheduler.
As soon as the target quantity through the CPS (FLOW_COR_CPS) is zero, which indicates a deactivation of
the CPS (noti?cation), and the time C_T_DL Y_ACT_STI_CPS_CYChas elapsed, the maximum expected differen-
tial pressure (PRS_DIF_ESTIM_DIAGCPS_TMP), the amplitude of the CPS activation (CPPWM_SP_CPS_DIAGCPS_
INTM) and the time constant for the ?lter for calculation of the expected differential pressure are calculated
from the basic amplitude C_CPPWM_SP_DIAGCPS_BAS_INIresults, depending on the charging state of the AKB
and depending on the current differential pressure between intake manifold and ambient.
The opening angles depending on the engine operating state are calculated in the sub-hierarchy VollMotor-
Betrieb [full engine operation], Halbmotorbetrieb [half-engine operation] and ScndLnTrbBetrieb . This value
is compared with the minimum value in the sub-hierarchies. The higher value of the two is ?nally used as
amplitude of the CPS actuation (CPPWM_SP_CPS_DIAGCPS_INTM).
An expected value is subsequently extracted from characteristic map, by considering the current differential
pressure and the valid amplitude for the stimulation of the CPS. In order to consider the dependence on the
current mass ?ow in the intake manifold (this can be retrieved from the rpm), the expected value is corrected
with a rpm-dependent factor.
The differential pressure to be expected PRS_DIF_ESTIM_DIAGCPS_TMPshould be adjusted, when stimulating
the CPS with the planned amplitude CPPWM_SP_CPS_DIAGCPS_INTM between the modeled and measured
manifold air pressure.

37.10.3.2.3.2.1.4 Initializations before the beginning of the stimulation of the CPS
In the initialization phase, the following initializations are carried out:
? Setting the condition for starting a stimulation cycle
? Withdrawal of the condition for the last stimulation cycle
? Initialization of the correlation analysis with the number of the
stimulation cycles to be performed C_NR_STI_CYC_CPS_MAX and
respectively C_CTR_STI_CYC_CPS_MAX_EOL
for end-of-line test
? Initialization of the low pass for the ?ltering of the modeled manifold air pressure ?ow.
? Counter reset for the already executed stimulation cycles
? Counter reset and sums for determining the average measured pressure amplitude when activating the
CPS
? Initialization of the low pass for the ?ltering of the ideal differential pressure ?ow during the stimulation
of the CPS with the differential pressure
? The state of the stimulation is recorded in STATE_CPS_DIAGCPS
Additionally the CCC class is initialized:
cccSumY=0;
cccSumYY=0;
cccSumX=0;
cccSumXX=0;
cccSumYX=0;
num=MAX(steps+1,1);
The method init serves for the initialization of sums and counters. With the parameter steps, before the begin-
ning, the number of the signal samplings is de?ned for the following analysis.
The value num cannot get the value 0. This is to avoid over?ow in division calculation of correlation coef?-
cient.

37.10.3.2.3.2.2 Overview of the stimulation phase of the subordinate state machine
The stimulation phase contains instructions that are counted permanently, in the beginning and at the end of a
stimulation cycle. The time that passes between the beginning and the end of a stimulation cycle are de?ned
in the hierarchy tiStiCyc. The number of cycles is counted with CTR_CPS_STI_CYC. As long as the condition
L V_LST_STI_CYC_CPSand resp. L V_LST_STI_CYC_CPS_CHA_MODis not ful?lled, in the end of a cycle the counter
is incremented and the condition for the start of a stimulation cycle L V_ST_STI_CYC_CPSis reset. The low pass
?ltering of the ideal target pressure ?ow (see CalcPressEstim hierarchy) is carried out permanently during the
stimulation of the CPS.

37.10.3.2.3.2.2.1 Initialization of a stimulation cycle
The instructions of the CycIni hierarchy are included in the instructions that must be performed in the be-
ginning of a stimulation cycle. Starting from the current value of the basic pattern NR_STI_PAT_CPSand the
expected differential pressure PRS_DIF_ESTIM_DIAGCPS_TMP, the ideal expected differential pressure ?owPRS_
DIF_ESTIM_DIAGCPS is issued for the current stimulation cycle. Afterwards, with the help of the basic pattern
(speci?ed in the sub-hierarchy ctStiCyc) and of the calculated PWM target amplitude, the current PWM value
to be output for the CPS activation is generated: CPPWM_SP_CPS_DIAGCPS.
When the applied number of stimulation cycles is reached (speci?ed in the sub-hierarchy ctStiCyc), the condi-
tion L V_LST_STI_CYC_CPSor respectively L V_LST_STI_CYC_CPS_CHA_MODis set. With a further instruction it is
veri?ed whether in the next stimulation cycle there is a change in the basic pattern.

37.10.3.2.3.2.2.1.1 Initialization of a stimulation cycle
In this hierarchy (ctStiCyc), the following variables are applied:
- the basic pattern for testing while driving for the intake point of the intake manifold (ID_NR_STI_PAT_CPS), for
the intake point before the compressor ( ID_NR_STI_PAT_CPS_CHA_MOD) and for the end-of-line test ( ID_NR_
STI_PAT_CPS_EOL)
- the number of stimulation cycles for driving in the intake point of the intake manifold (C_CTR_STI_CYC_CPS_
MAX), for the intake point before the compressor (C_CTR_STI_CYC_CPS_MAX_CHA_MOD) and for the end-of-line
test (C_NR_STI_CYC_CPS_MAX_EOL)
The canister purge valve is tested during the end-of-line testing with the same test strategy as while driving. In
the end-of-line testing however there is no canister purge requested, the charging state of the AKB is unknown.
In order to reduce the in?uence of potential oily mixture in the AKB, the basic pattern and the number of
stimulation cycles are established separately for the end-of-line test.

37.10.3.2.3.2.2.2 Calculation of the expected differential pressure ?ow
The differential pressure ?ow ( PRS_DIF_ESTIM_FIL_DIAGCPS) is generated by means of a low pass ?ltering
of the expected value (PRS_DIF_ESTIM_DIAGCPS). The time constant for the ?lter necessary for this (T_FIL_
PRS_DIF_ESTIM) is calculated once before the initialization of the CPS stimulation begins (StiIni hierarchy) and
prepared.
Disturbing in?uences, such as the dead time for the CPS control can be considered, if needed, by means of
a suitable application ( L V_ACT_PRS_DIF_ESTIM_DL Y = true) in the differential pressure ?ow. The dead time is
mapped in the differential pressure ?ow, in that the expected value is made available as input to the ?lter with a
delay (PRS_DIF_ESTIM_DLY_DIAGCPS). The delay is speci?ed by means of a counter (CTR_CYC_PRS_DIF_ESTIM_
DLY) that is incremented by a step with every call. In this process, a step corresponds to 20ms which is the
cycle time of the DIAGCPS algorithm. The waiting time can be applied by means of the maximum number
of steps that the counter shall run through (C_CTR_CYC_PRS_DIF_ESTIM_DLY). Only when the counter reaches
its threshold and the new CPS was initialized ( L V_CPPWM_INI_DIAGCPS = true), the expected value is written
in PRS_DIF_ESTIM_DL Y_DIAGCPSand is made available to the ?lter as input.

37.10.3.2.3.2.2.4 Signal sampling and calculation of intermediary results
At the end of a stimulation cycle, the differential pressure signals PRS_DIF_ESTIM_FIL_DIAGCPSand PRS_DIF_
CP_DIAGCPSare sampled for the correlation analyses. In order to be able to specify with certainty the value
ranges for the elements used subsequently, the determined differential pressure PRS_DIF_CP_DIAGCPS has
lower and upper limits. Moreover, the determined differential pressurePRS_DIF_CP_DIAGCPSand the modeled
differential pressure is foreseen with an offset before the allocation. In this way, a signed variable can be
avoided. By means of the instruction calc_sums, sums are generated in the correlation analysis that are used
at the end of the stimulation phase for determining the correlation coef?cients.
The second part of the instructions refers to determining the average values of the minimum and maximum
differential pressure amplitude that occurred. The currently determined and limited differential pressure PRS_
DIF_CP_REC_DIAGCPS is used for determining the average values only when the stimulation of the CPS
changes in the following stimulation cycle or when this is the last stimulation cycle.

37.10.3.2.3.2.2.5 Finalization of the diagnosis
If the last stimulation cycle is reached, the result of the diagnosis after calculation of the intermediary results
(CalcSumMinMax hierarchy) is determined.
In the ?rst step, the average values of the minimum and the maximum amplitudesPRS_DIF_CP_DIAGCPS_MIN_
MV and PRS_DIF_CP_DIAGCPS_MAX_MV are determined from the sums and counters calculated step-by step.
The difference of the two values is the variable PRS_DIF_CP_DIAGCPS_DIF_MV corrected for offset. This variable
is a measure for the average differential pressure actually resulting from the modeled and measured manifold
air pressure. Together with the expected differential pressure PRS_DIF_ESTIM_DIAGCPS_TMP, the ratioRATIO_
PRS_DIF_MV_PRS_DIF_ESTIM is generated. The correlation factor is determined in the second step. The result
of the correlation, the correlation coef?cient, is stored in CRLC_BAS_DIAGCPS. Finally, the result is multiplied by
RATIO_PRS_DIF_MV_PRS_DIF_ESTIM and stored in CRLC_COR_DIAGCPS.
Thus, the determined correlation factor is corrected, depending on the determined differential pressure.
The next step is a plausibility check that must be undergone by the result (DiagPlausChk hierarchy). The ?nal
instructions (DiagFin hierarchy) are executed only when the result was con?rmed.

37.10.3.2.3.2.2.5.3 Method of calculation of correlation coef?cient
cccSumXXmittel=cccSumXX - (cccSumX * cccSumX) /num ;
cccSumYYmittel=cccSumYY - (cccSumY * cccSumY) /num ;
cccSumYXmittel=cccSumYX - (cccSumX * cccSumY) /num ;
cccNum=cccSumYXmittel * cccSumYXmittel ;
cccDiv= cccSumXXmittel * cccSumYYmittel ;
if (cccDiv==0)
{
return 0;
}
else
{
return (MAX(cccNum/cccDiv), 0);
}
After the step-by-step signal sampling is ?nalized, the cross-correlation coef?cient is calculated with the method
get_ccc and made available as return value.

37.10.3.2.3.4 Action on end of "Active" diagnostic state
The following operations are executed when leaving the state diagnosis "active":
? Withdrawal of the request for terminating/disabling of the canister purge
? Withdrawal of the request for disabling the fast charging compensation
? Reset of the plausibility errors
? Reset of the mass ?ow output by the diagnosis and of the duty cycle for CPS
? Reset of the subordinate state machine for stimulation of the CPS

37.10.3.3 Lambda deviation check during End Of Line
The lambda deviation check is running during EOL, when the MEC_OPEN_CPS diagnosis is performing diag-
nostic stimuli via the canister purge valve.
For this purpose, the lambda values and lambda controller values are stored at the beginning of the stimulation.
During the stimulation the difference between the current values and the values at the beginning is calculated.

37.11.2 DIAGCPS inhibition (LV_INH_DIAGCPS)
� General Information
In case of system errors, the diagnostic for the canister purge valve has to be inhibited. The ?ag LV_INH_
DIAGCPS is used as input in the CPS check core function to disable activation of the test for the whole driving
cycle as LV_INH_DIAGCPS is only reset after clear failure memory, reset and new driving cycle.
Two NC_FIDs are used to check the permission for a CPS diagnostic cycle: NC_FID_ERR_DIAGCPS and NC_FID_
ERR_DIAGCPS_2. Two are necessary, as it is pretty likely, that more than 125 errors are used to lock the cps
diagnosis.
� Application Conditions
Activation: always
Recurrence: 20 ms
� Function Description
/* Important: NC_FID_ERR_MEC_OPEN_CPS_1 + NC_FID_ERR_MEC_OPEN_CPS_2 are used
to inhibit both diagnostic instances NC_IDX_ERR_MEC_OPEN_CPS_1/2. */
ACTION_FARM_GetPermission(<NC_FID_ERR_DIAGCPS>, LV_PRMS_1)
ACTION_FARM_GetPermission(<NC_FID_ERR_DIAGCPS_2>, LV_PRMS_2)
IF LV_FID_READY = 1
THEN
IF ( LC_SWI_TAM_INH_DIAGCPS = 1 AND
LV_ST_END = 1 AND
TAM_ST < C_TAM_ST_MIN_DIAGCPS[IDX_VAR_EMI] ) OR
LV_PRMS_1 = 0 OR
LV_PRMS_2 = 0
THEN LV_INH_DIAGCPS = 1
ENDIF
ENDIF

37.11.3 DIAGCPS error interface (MEC_OPEN_CPS)
� General Information
Within this speci?cation, the interface to the error management is created. This means, that temporary (_TMP)
end_diag and err ?ags from the basic CPS-check function are consumed and according to their transitions and
actual values the errors MEC_OPEN_CPS_1 and MEC_OPEN_CPS_2 are set.
Depending on the engine con?guration - pressure sensor mounted (LV_PRS_SENS_INS_CP_PIPE = 1 or = 0)
inside turbo purge line - the number of MEC_OPEN_CPS results is determined. Without pressure sensor, there
is only MEC_OPEN_CPS_1
With pressure sensor mounted there are two MEC_OPEN_CPS results: MEC_OPEN_CPS_1 and MEC_OPEN_CPS_
2.
If the passive CL-Check or the Lambda deviation check in EOL for a diagnosis path is ?nished, the LV_END_
DIAG_MEC_OPEN_CPS_i of the respective path i is set.
The passive CL-Check and Lambda deviation check in EOL are able to detect an "OK" result only.
In projects for the US market the passive Check (CL-Check) has to be switched-off !

37.11.4 DIAGCPS RBM interface
� General Information
As MEC_OPEN_CPS_1/2 are OBD relevant diagnostic instances that do not run continuously, RBM data have to
be provided for each of them.
For RBM calculation there exist certain conditions:
- The calculation is locked, in case system errors (LV_INH_DIAGCPS = 1) are present.
- The denominator is increased (by 1), in case engine cold start (LV_DC_CDN_CST_RBM) was detected.
- The numerator is increased immediately, in case of failure: LV_DIAG_MEC_OPEN_CPS_NOK_RBM = 1.
For the non-failure case a legal requirement demands that the time until the numerator is incremented after
end of diagnosis must be as long as the whole time duration it would have taken in the failure case. That?s why
a work-around with the timer T_DIAGCPS_STEP_2_RBM and the counter CTR_DIAGCPS_DLY_RBM is built-up to
establish this delay between end of diagnosis and increment of numerator.

37.11.5 DIAGCPS Mode6
� General Information
Non-continuous, OBD relevant diagnostic instances must provide Mode6 values. Mode6 values represent
the measured values during the actual diagnostic that lead to the current diagnostic result. Together with the
minimum and maximum respectively possible value these Mode6 data are made available to the scan tool.
On reset, these Mode6 data is read from NVMY in which it was stored at end of power latch in the previous
driving cycle. They are overwritten only, when a new diagnostic result is available again, so when the end-diag
?ag of MEC_OPEN_CPS_1/2 is present again in the new driving cycle.

� General Information
Within this module the main software features are realized to run a tank leakage diagnosis based on DMTL.
The features are:
a) Central DMTL state machine, STATE_DMTL, in which the latest pump current results are analysed (with
regard to the diagnosis duration) and the ?nal diagnosis results are created
b) Acquisition of the pump voltage (at the pin)
c) Calculation of (?ltered) pump currents (CUR_DMTL_COR_FIL, etc.)
d) Determination of diagnosis cancel conditions (leading to LV_DMTL_STOP)
e) Enabling of rough and small leak diagnosis (LV_ENA_ROUGH/SMALL_LEAK_MES)
f) Refueling and fuel-cap-open detection (LV_REFU and LV_FUC_OPEN)

g) Heater control (LV_HDMTL_ON)
h) EOL test for DMTL (STATE_DMTL_EOL)
Important to know:
The function is basically enabled via the variant bit LV_CONF_DMTL which is set to 1 via the data record if the
DMTL module is installed. That means, if LV_CONF_DMTL is set to 0, all DMTL related modules in the software
are not calculated.
37.12.1 Central sequencing control, STATE_DMTL
� General Information
The sequence of measurements of the individual currents and coordination of the various output stages
pertaining to the DMTL module is ensured by the central sequencing control. To get a quick overview about
the main variables used and produced in the different states of STATE_DMTL, the pictures below have been
incorporated. Textual explanations are given below each picture.

EVAM, Leakage detection pump function diagnosis
Figure 37.12.1: Enable and abort conditions for DMTL state machine
Rough and Small leak diagnosis can be enabled in two principal ways: Manually, by the calibration variable
C_COD_DMTL, or in the normal way, if system is in power latch and certain other conditions are given. In both
cases, the ?nal output for rough leak is the ?ag LV_ENA_ROUGH_LEAK_MES_ONLY and for small leak LV_ENA_
SMALL_LEAK_MES. When one of these ?ags is set, the bit LV_ENA_ROUGH_LEAK_MES gets set and the state
machine is engaged, that means the state machine switches from its initial position "START" to "REF_LEAK_
MES". At this moment, the pump is turned on, and the central sequence control (or state machine) is activated,
indicated by the ?ag LV_DMTL_ACT = 1.
In case LV_DMTL_STOP switches to 1, a running state machine is immediately aborted and several parameters
(?ags, timers, currents and states) are set back to their initial values. After an abortion, another DMTL sequence
control can not be started unless a reset event or a key-on event takes place.
Certain conditions that lead to the setting of the abortion ?ag LV_DMTL_STOP, like LV_CUR_DMTL_REF_DIF_
MAX or LV_CUR_DMTL_THD_DIF_MES, can lead, depending on the calibration value C_SUM_CNL_SMALL_
LEAK_MES_MAX, to a DMTL module error, DMTL_SIG.
As soon as the basic state machine enabling ?ag LV_ENA_ROUGH_LEAK_MES is set, the reference leak mea-
surement starts. The subsequent sequence control is visualized in the picture below.
File: AEB00C01.00K
10668Project: VW SIMOS 18.1 EA888 Document key: 10213413 SPE 000 DE
Baseline: SC8L50Y0 Copyright Continental AG

EVAM, Leakage detection pump function diagnosis
Figure 37.12.2: DMTL state machine sequence: Part 1 (from start to end of rough leak diagnosis)
At the end of the reference leak measurement, which lasts till C_T_REF_LEAK_MES_MAX, it is checked whether
the pump current was in between calibration limits. If it wasn?t, the diagnosis ends right away with "MODULE_
ERROR", setting an DMTL_MAX or DMTL_MIN error. (The errors are indicated by the ?ags LV_CUR_DMTL_REF_
MES_MAX/MIN generated in the state machine process. In the picture the ?ags are not shown).
If the current was within the limits, the state machine continues with "ROUGH_LEAK_MES". At the moment,
when the state machine switches from "REF_LEAK_MES" to "ROUGH_LEAK_MES" the solenoid is opened (LV_
DMTLS_ON = 1) and the air ?ow from the pump gets directed into the tank. When the solenoid is opened, the
pump current must decrease as the pressure in the tank is lower than the pressure that existed in the reference
leak housing. Therefore the electric resistance and the power consumption decrease lead to a clearly lower
pump current value. So to proof the working of the solenoid, the pump current needs to fall down a certain
value below the reference current value, CUR_DMTL_REF_LEAK. This value is de?ned by C_CUR_DMTL_COR_
FIL_OFS_AMP. A too low current drop leads to another DMTL module error setting, DMTL_PLAUS, and to an
immediate stop of the diagnosis/state machine. (The plausibility failure is indicated by the ?ag LV_CUR_DMTL_
DMTLS_TEST = 1).
If no plausibility failure did occur during "ROUGH_LEAK_MES", the state machine continues checking the cur-
rent input CUR_DMTL_COR_FIL. If the current exceeds the threshold CUR_DMTL_THD_ROUGH_LEAK, the value
is memorized (CUR_DMTL_ROUGH_LEAK_END) and the state machine switches over to the state "ROUGH_
LEAK_MES_END".
If the current value does not exceed the threshold even after C_T_ACT_ROUGH_LEAK_MAX seconds have
passed, the state machine switches to "ROUGH_LEAK_MES_LEN", continuing its measurement and compare
for an additional extended time (C_T_ACT_LEAK_MES_MAX). If even after the extended time the current did
not exceed the threshold, the state machine switches to the second reference leak measurement "REF_LEAK_
MES_2". (Further process after switch to "REF_LEAK_MES_2", see next picture (Part 2) below).
If it surpasses the threshold CUR_DMTL_THD_ROUGH_LEAK_LEN the state machine switches, like it did in
"ROUGH_LEAK_MES" to the state "ROUGH_LEAK_MES_END". It then only checks if a request for a further small
File: AEB00C01.00K
10669Project: VW SIMOS 18.1 EA888 Document key: 10213413 SPE 000 DE
Baseline: SC8L50Y0 Copyright Continental AG

Copyright �Continental AG. Transmittal, reproduction, dissemination and/or editing of this document as well as utilisation of its contents and communication thereof to others without
expressed authorisation are prohibited. Offenders will be held liable for payment of damages. All rights created by patent grant or registration of a utility model or design patent are reserved.
EVAM, Leakage detection pump function diagnosis
leak check (LV_EAN_SMALL_LEAK_MES) is given. If so, the state machine continues with "SMALL_LEAK_MES".
(Further process after switch to "SMALL_LEAK_MES", see second picture below).If not, the diagnosis is ?n-
ished with no rough leak error. (This is indicated with LV_ROUGH_LEAK_SUSP = 0 and LV_CYC_ROUGH_LEAK_
SUSP = 1 but not displayed in the picture).
Figure 37.12.3: DMTL state machine sequence: Part 2 (2nd reference leak measurement after rough leak
suspect detection)
When at the end of the max-time for rough leak diagnosis, the current value stayed below the threshold it
has to be veri?ed if the reference current value changed. This check is done in the "REF_LEAK_MES_2" state.
So during "REF_LEAK_MES_2" the reference current value CUR_DMTL_REF_LEAK is measured again. With the
new reference value, new thresholds are derived (CUR_DMTL_THD_ROUGH_LEAK_LEN and CUR_DMTL_THD_
ROUGH_LEAK) which are used at the end of the reference measurement, T_ACT_REF_LEAK_MES >C_T_REF_
LEAK_MES_REP_MAX) for diagnosis decision.
Like in the ?rst reference measurement state, a module error can be detected in the second reference mea-
surement as well, in case the current value was too low or too high. (Like before, this is indicated with the
?ags LV_CUR_DMTL_REF_MES_MAX/MIN). If a DMTL_MAX or DMTL_MIN error is detected, the diagnosis ends
immediately and delivers no result for rough or small leak.
In case no module error was detected, the last measured current value before the state "REF_LEAK_MES_2", so
CUR_DMTL_ROUGH_LEAK(_LEN)_END is compared to the new derived thresholds. If even now the memorized
current value is below the new thresholds, a rough leak is detected. The state machine switches to "ROUGH_
LEAK" (and sets the ?ags LV_ROUGH_LEAK_SUSP = 1 and LV_CYC_ROUGH_LEAK_SUSP = 1).
If a rough leak suspect was set (LV_REF_LEAK_ROUGH_LEAK_SUSP = 1) but the current value during the nor-
mal rough leak measurement (not in the extension phase!) is now greater than the new threshold, the state
machine switches to "ROUGH_LEAK_MES_END" and eventually to "END_DMTL" with the detection of no rough
leak by having the ?ags LV_ROUGH_LEAK_SUSP set to 0 and LV_CYC_ROUGH_LEAK_SUSP set to 1.
If the latter was not the case, the system is declared to have a small leak. The state machine switches to
"SMALL_LEAK" (and sets the bits LV_ERR_DET_SMALL_LEAK_MIN =1 and LV_CYC_SMALL_LEAK_MODE6 =1. The
?ags are not displayed in the picture).

EVAM, Leakage detection pump function diagnosis
Figure 37.12.4: DMTL state machine sequence: Part 3 (small leak measurement/diagnosis)
When no rough leak was detected, and a small leak check was requested by LV_ENA_SMALL_LEAK_MES =
1, the state machine gets into the state "SMALL_LEAK_MES". In this state, the absolute value of the doubled
?ltered pump current is compared to reference current value CUR_DMTL_REF_LEAK, but also the gradient of
the pump current is monitored and used as a criteria to declare the tank as leaky or not leaky. The gradient is
not used directly for the compare but ?gradient timers? which record the duration of time in which the current
gradient was in between, below or above certain boundaries.
Info: If the pump current constantly increase in a linear way, the timer T_CUR_DMTL_GRD_OK_1 increases. This
signalizes that the tank is tight. When the pump current gradient is very low or even zero, which means that
the pump current value does not increase any more, the timer T_CUR_DMTL_GRD_L increases.
The timer T_CUR_DMTL_GRD_OK_1 monitors the gradient when the current is below the reference current and
the T_CUR_DMTL_GRD_OK_2 monitors it when it?s above).
So in the ?rst check path (in the picture above), which is selected when CUR_DMTL_COR_FIL_GRD is below the
reference current, it is checked at the end of the small leak measurement(C_T_ACT_LEAK_MES_MAX) whether
the current gradient time was not in the linear range (T_CUR_DMTL_GRD_OK_1 = 0). Also, but this check is
independent from the point in time during the small leak measurement, it is checked if the current gradient was
very low for a certain period of time and lead to an increase of the timer T_CUR_DMTL_GRD_L that exceeded
the threshold C_T_MIN_CUR_DMTL_GRD_L. Both criteria, in combination with the pump current below the
threshold, give clear evidence that the tank is leaky. The state machine switches to "SMALL_LEAK" (and sets
the bits LV_ERR_DET_SMALL_LEAK_MIN = 1 and LV_CYC_SMALL_LEAK_MODE6 = 1. The ?ags are not displayed
in the picture).
In the second check path, which is selected when the current is greater than the reference current, the tank is
declared as not-leaky ("TANK_PROOFED") when ...
a) the linear gradient timers below (T_CUR_DMTL_GRD_OK_1) and above (T_CUR_DMTL_GRD_OK_2) the current
reference exceeded calibratable thresholds. So the pump current gradient was constantly linear for a certain
period of time. Or, ...
b) the linear gradient timer above (T_CUR_DMTL_GRD_OK_2) the current reference exceeds a separate calibra-
tion threshold. That means, regardless to the shape of the pump gradient current below the reference current
threshold, the gradient above the threshold is used as diagnosis result criteria. (To compensate the ?missing?
T_CUR_DMTL_GRD_OK_1 data, the calibration timer value for C_T_MIN_CUR_DMTL_GRD_OK_2_ONLY should be
calibrated to a clearly higher value compared to C_T_MIN_CUR_DMTL_GRD_OK_2). Or, ..
c) the pump current keeps increasing and exceeds a threshold clearly higher than the reference current.

EVAM, Leakage detection pump function diagnosis
Criteria a) - c) lead to "TANK_PROOFED" and to LV_ERR_DET_SMALL_LEAK_MIN = 0 and LV_CYC_SMALL_LEAK_
MODE6 = 1.
In the third check path, which is selected when the current is greater than the reference current, the tank is
declared as leaky ("SMALL_LEAK") when ...
a) the gradient timer for really low current gradients exceeds a threshold, so the pump current does not
increase any more, and the last measured pump current value is, like mentioned before, above the reference
current value, but below a safety factor threshold (C_FAC_CUR_DMTL_LEAK_DET). Or, ...
b) the linear gradient timer above (T_CUR_DMTL_GRD_OK_2) the current reference is zero, and the max time
for small leak diagnosis is reached.
Criteria a) - b) lead to "SMALL_LEAK" and to LV_ERR_DET_SMALL_LEAK_MIN = 1 and LV_CYC_SMALL_LEAK_
MODE6 = 1.
More information, especially about the exact calculation and setting of variables and ?ags, can be found in the
following pseudo code below.

37.12.2 Pump current of DMTL module: VB depending pump current correction
� General Information
At the end of the reference measurement, the ?ltered battery voltage VB_DMTL_REF is measured and moni-
tored for a higher deviation in the following rough or small leak measurement (STATE_DMTL>1h and STATE_
DMTL <7H). If a high battery voltage deviation is detected, LV_VB_DIF_MAX is set and the diagnosis is aborted.

EVAM, Leakage detection pump function diagnosis
37.12.3 Pump current of DMTL module: Acquisition of pump current
� General Information
The most important input of the "tank leakage diagnostic function" represents the pump current of the DMTL
module. The current to be evaluated is recorded and calculated by voltage measurement at the corresponding
shunts (V_DMTL). To detect the equivalent current from the measured voltage V_DMTL which is generated in
the control unit using the measurement shunt, the voltage value is divided by the calibration constant C_R_
DMTL (Ohm).
Subsequently, the calculated current is corrected, leading to CUR_DMTL_COR.
� Application Conditions
Activation: LV_CONF_DMTL = 1
Deactivation: -
Recurrence: 1 ms / 10 ms
� Function Description
Recurrence 1 ms:
ACTION_INFR_GetVDmtl(OUT <v_dmt>)
V_DMTL_SUM = V_DMTL_SUM + V_DMTL
x = x + 1
If x > 9
Then
CUR_DMTL = V_DMTL_SUM / (x * C_R_DMTL)
V_DMTL_SUM = 0
x = 0
Endif
Recurrence: 10 ms
CUR_DMTL_COR = CUR_DMTL * FAC_CUR_DMTL
37.12.4 Pump current of DMTL module: Filtering of pump current
� General Information
The acquired and corrected pump current CUR_DMTL_COR is not suitable for usage in the DMTL diagnosis.
The signal is too noisy. Due to this, the value is low passed ?ltered leading to CUR_DMTL_COR_FIL. (At the
beginning of the reference measurement (T_DLY_DMTLS >0) the ?ltering is weaker due to expected bigger
current value changes ->masking-out).
For detection of refueling events, CUR_DMTL_COR_FIL gets ?ltered once, leading to CUR_DMTL_COR_FIL_
REFU and a second time leading to CUR_DMTL_COR_FIL_REFU. If the difference of these two currents gets
too high, a refueling event is detected. (For more information, see de?nition of LV_CUR_DMT_THD_DIF_MES).
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: On clr_fmy and ECU_STATE = NOT(?PWL?) to ?PWL?
T_DLY_DET_REFU = 0
VB_DMTL_FIL_FUC_OPEN = VB

37.12.5 Interruption of function due to current ?uctuations
� General Information
The function block monitors the ?ltered pump current for excessively high current ?uctuations during the
reference leakage measurement. If strong ?uctuations are detected, the tank leakage diagnosis is aborted.
The interruption is cumulated in a counter.

37.12.6 Power latch extension request setting
� General Information
A DMTL diagnosis cycle normally takes place in power latch. As this diagnosis can last several minutes, the
system needs to be informed to enable a power latch extension, as otherwise an ongoing diagnosis would be
aborted by the power latch shut-down event.
The power latch extension is signalized with LV_REQ_PWL_DMTL. It is set with set_pwl_lock_cdn(NC_PWL_
LOCK_CDN_EVAP) and cleared with clr_pwl_lock_cdn(NC_PWL_LOCK_CDN_EVAP).
The power latch phase in the non-failure case for rough and small leak diagnosis are continued even though
the diagnosis has already ?nished. This is necessary, as an OBD requirement requests, that the RBM test
evaluation duration in the non-failure case must be as long as the duration that would have been necessary
for a test cycle with a failure case. (The ?ags LV_DET_SMALL/ROUGH_LEAK/VIRT are bits generated in the
DMTL-RBM module signalizing that the RBM test evaluation is ?nished).
� Application Conditions

37.12.10 Output stage test request and DMTL dry run request
� General Information
Output stage tests (LV_DR_DMTL, etc.) are necessary for simple functional checks of the pump and solenoid
of the DMTL without activating the diagnosis part.
With the dry-run (LV_DMTL_TEST_RUN) of the DMTL, the pump is prepared during an engine running phase
for the possible subsequent diagnosis phase in power latch. During the dry-run, there is no diagnosis ongoing.
It?s purpose is to reduce possible negative impacts of a ?cold? pump on the diagnostic results.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At ERU -> PWL
LV_DMTL_TEST_RUN = 0
Activation: LV_CONF_DMTL = 1
Recurrence: 100 ms

37.12.11 Fuel-cap-open, Refueling, Current-decrease and DMTL-Max-duration-time detec-
tion
� General Information
During an ongoing DMTL tank leak diagnosis, several parameters, depending on the pump current and
time, are checked in parallel.
1. LV_DET_REFU (refueling detection)
Refueling events must lead to an immediate cancelling of an ongoing diagnosis, as the abrupt current
increase (due to the increased pressure in the tank) would lead to false results.
Refueling is detected, when the current increase is too fast.
2. LV_DET_FUC_OPEN (fuel cap open detection)
Open fuel caps lead to false ROUGH_LEAK (error) results. Therefore its detection must lead to an imme-
diate cancellation of an ongoing diagnosis.
Open fuel caps can be detected, if there is almost no current increase detectable after solenoid has been
switched to ?open? and the air ?ow is pumped into the tank.
3. LV_CUR_DMTL_THD_DIF_MES (current decrease)
Current decrease signalize a still ?humid? DMTL pump or an opening of the fuel cap. These events must
lead to an immediate cancellation of the diagnosis. Moreover, this will lead to an DMTL module failure,
DMTL_SIG.
4. LV_T_DMTL_MAX (max time for DMTL diagnosis reached)
� Application Conditions

LV_DET_REFU = 0
LV_CUR_DMTL_THD_DIF_MES = 0
LV_T_DMTL_MAX = 0
CTR_CUR_DMTL_REF_DIF_MAX = 0
CTR_CNL_SMALL_LEAK_MES = 0
On ECU_STATE = NOT(?PWL?) to ?PWL?
LV_DET_FUC_OPEN = 0

37.12.12 Heater DMTL module
� General Information
The DMTL Heater is started as soon as the engine is running. The DMTL heater is needed to reduce the
humidity from the DMTL module. The humidity can lead to bad current measurements or to current ?uctua-
tions.
� Application Conditions

Deactivation: -

37.12.13 DMTL End of Line test
� General Information
At end of production line or in the garage it is necessary to start the DMTL test by a ShortTrip request. The
ShortTripRequester sets the ?ag LV_DMTL_EOL.
In case the short trip is requested right after the production (TRT very small) a special test pattern can be
seelcted. In this case, LV_REQ_DMTL_EOL_FIRST is set and allows to continue the EOL test even after interrup-
tions (due battery voltage loss, current ?uctuations, etc.). It is only set back on key-on event and when max
EOL-Time, C_DMTL_EOL_MAX has been reached.
The EOL test is ended, if a valid result, error or no error (see STATE_DMTL_EOL >=30 and <40) is present.
The test is cancelled, if LV_DMTL_EOL_CNL ?ag is set. It continues if LV_REQ_DMTL_EOL_FIRST is set. If not,
then the test is ended after cancellation.
If at the beginning of the test, the battery voltage is not within range or electrical faults are present, the the
tester is informed with "function can not be started".
STATE_DMTL_EOL stores the latest EOL test results in a detailed statement.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: on Rst, clr_fmy and igkoff2on:
LV_DMTL_EOL_END, LV_DMTL_EOL_CNL, LV_DMTL_EOL_FIRST_INTR, LV_

ASA = 0
T_DLY_DMTL_EOL_INTR = 0
STATE_DMTL_EOL is restored from NVMY;
STATE_DMTL_EOL = 255(dec)on NVMY init

In this module, several DMTL related software features are de?ned. The features are necessary to run a DMTL
test during normal vehicle operation.
37.13.1 General activation of DMTL functionality
� General Information
All DMTL related software modules are only calculated when the main switch is set to 0. The main switch for
DMTL is LV_CONF_DMTL which is de?ned with C_CONF_DMTL.
On ECU start-up, the information LV_CONF_DMTL = C_CONF_DMTL has to be read out ?rst. Otherwise, all
NVMY variables de?ned in the DMTL functionality will be initialised with 0.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: at ECU reset (but) before NVMY reading:
LV_CONF_DMTL = C_CONF_DMTL
Activation: always
Recurrence: 100 ms
� Function Description
LV_CONF_DMTL = C_CONF_DMTL
37.13.2 Main enabling ?ags for DMTL functionality
� General Information
To enable the leak detection in the tank system some conditions have to be given. The check for these
conditions are given below. In the end, the output of the check are three ?ags:
a) LV_ENA_LEAK_DMTL: No system errors present. DMTL test can run.
b) LV_REQ_DIAG_ROUGH_LEAK_REFU: Refueling detected. ROUGH_LEAK_REFU check requested
c) LV_ENA_MAIN_DMTL: Environmental conditions given to run a DMTL leak check.
� Application Conditions

LV_REQ_DIAG_ROUGH_LEAK_REFU = 0

37.13.2.1 De?nition of basic enabling ?ag for DMTL check, LV_ENA_LEAK_DMTL
/* The purpose of the flag LV_ENA_LEAK_DMTL is to enable or disable the DMTL
function due to present system errors that might lead to wrong DMTL diagnostic
results. */
***************************************************************************
ACTION_FARM_GetPermission (<NC_FID_ENA_LEAK_DMTL,OUT<LV_PRMS>)
LV_ENA_LEAK_DMTL = LV_PRMS
37.13.2.2 Refueling event detection for enabling ROUGH_LEAK_REFU check
/*Within the diagnostic functionality of DMTL, it is possible to distinguish
between real rough leak errors and rough leak errors after a refuelling event
which signals that the fuel cap has probably not been closed or not thoroughly
closed before.(This refuelling rough leak error is not OBD (MIL) relevant.)
The refuelling information comes from the FUTL aggregate. In case there is
no valid signal from the fuel tank level available, a refuelling event can not
be detected and therefore this functionality is not activated.
If Engine cold start is detected (LV_TCO_ST_DMTL = 1), this functionality is
also not activated, because then the OBD-Diagnosis Tank Leak shall be performed
*/
***************************************************************************
ACTION_FARM_GetPermission(<NC_FID_DMTL_ROUGH_LEAK_REFU,OUT<LV_PRMS>)
ACTION_ERRM_GetErrmStatus(IN<NC_IDX_ERR_ROUGH_LEAK_REFU>,
OUT <STATE_ERR_ROUGH_LEAK_REFU>)
If Bit 5 of STATE_ERR_ROUGH_LEAK_REFU = 1 OR //end_diag set
LV_DMTL_ASA = 1 OR
LV_TCO_ST_DMTL = 1
Then LV_REQ_DIAG_ROUGH_LEAK_REFU = 0
Else
If LC_REQ_DIAG_ROUGH_LEAK_REFU_MAN = 1 OR
( LV_PRMS = 1 AND
LV_ES = 0 AND
LV_FTL_IGK_CYC_REFU_DEFU = 1 )
Then LV_REQ_DIAG_ROUGH_LEAK_REFU = 1
Endif
Endif

EVAM, Leakage detection pump function diagnosis (Appl. Inc.)
37.13.2.3 De?nition of LV_ENA_MAIN_DMTL
/*In order to retrieve valid results during a running leak check, the battery
voltage has to be within a certain range. If not, an ongoing diagnostic is immediately
aborted or the diagnostic does not start*/
IF (VB > C_VB_DMTL_MIN AND VB <= C_VB_DMTL_MAX)
THEN T_VB_DLY_DMTL = C_T_VB_DLY_DMTL
LV_VB_VAL_DMTL = 1
ELSE
IF T_VB_DLY_DMTL = 0
THEN LV_VB_VAL_DMTL = 0
ELSE T_VB_DLY_DMTL = T_VB_DLY_DMTL - 100ms
ENDIF
ENDIF
/*A normal, not manually activated DMTL check, runs only when engine is stopped
and the ECU is in power latch. Moreover, no inhibiting error (LV_ENA_LEAK_DMTL)
should be present.*/
/*In case a refuelling event has been detected, no other environmental conditions
need to be fullfilled.*/
/*For normal rough leak or small leak error detection, some more environmental
conditions have to be given such like, ambient pressure above threshold, ambient
temperature within limits, cold start occurred, vehicle speed below threshold
and the engine running time has to be above a certain limit.*/
IF ECU_STATE = PWL AND
LV_ES = 1 AND
LV_ENA_LEAK_DMTL = 1 AND
LV_VB_VAL_DMTL = 1 AND
LV_CRASH = 0 AND
LV_DMTL_ASA = 0 AND
AMP > C_AMP_DMTL_MAX AND
C_TAM_DMTL_MIN < TAM <= C_TAM_DMTL_MAX AND
VS < C_VS_DMTL_MAX AND
TCO_ST >= C_TCO_ST_DMTL_MIN AND
T_AST_STOP >= C_T_AST_DMTL_MAX
Then LV_ENA_MAIN_DMTL = 1
Else LV_ENA_MAIN_DMTL = 0
Endif

37.13.3 Fuel-cap-open detection / Fuel-cap-lamp illumination
� General Information
ROUGH_LEAK and ROUGH_LEAK_REFU error detection is used for ?ller-cap-open lamp illumination in the
dashboard. With the error ROUGH_LEAK_REFU the illumination is always possible, as soon as an error is
detected. With ROUGH_LEAK a ?ller cap open illumination is only possible on the ?rst error detection. In case
the error is con?rmed, the ?ller cap illumination lamp is turned off (LV_FUC_OPEN_LAMP = 0) and the MIL is
turned on instead.
The duration of illumination for both error cases is de?ned with T_ACT_FUC_OPEN.

// Get error Status from ERRM of ROUGH_LEAK and ROUGH_LEAK_REFU
state_err_tmp_1 = ACTION_ERRM_GetErrmStatus(<NC_IDX_ERR_ROUGH_LEAK>)
state_err_tmp_2 = ACTION_ERRM_GetErrmStatus(<NC_IDX_ERR_ROUGH_LEAK_REFU>)
// Check, whether rough leak error has been confirmed
If Bit 1 of C_COD_2_DMTL = 1 (zero based)
Then
tmp_RoughLeakStatusFlag = 0h
ACTION_ERRM_GetErrMem(NC_IDX_ERR_ROUGH_LEAK, PRM_LV_ERR_MEM_2)
ACTION_ERRM_GetErr(NC_IDX_ERR_ROUGH_LEAK, PRM_LV_ERR_2)
// Check if rough-leak failure is in dynamic memory
// if not, respective bits stay on zero
If PRM_LV_ERR_MEM_2 = 1
Then
For IDX_DYN = 0 to CTR_ERR_DYN_NR-1
If (DIAG_INST[IDX_DYN] = PRM_IDX_ERR_ROUGH_LEAK) AND
LV_ERR_MKD[IDX_DYN] = 0
Then
// Confirmed DTC for rough_leak
tmp_RoughLeakStatusFlag = LV_ERR_CFM[IDX_DYN]
Endif
EndFor
Endif
Else
tmp_RoughLeakStatusFlag = 0h
Endif
// *** Fuel cap open detection logic ***
// Fuel cap open detection is valid (LV_FUC_OPEN_DET = 1) if...
// a) ROUGH_LEAK error is detected and not yet confirmed
// b) ROUGH_LEAK_REFU error is detected and ROUGH_LEAK not confirmed
If(1) tmp_RoughLeakStatusFlag = 0 // rough failure not confirmed
Then(1)
If(2) Bit 5 of state_err_tmp_1 = 1 OR //rough_leak end set
Bit 5 of state_err_tmp_2 = 1 //rough_leak_refu end set
Then(2)
If(3) Bit 0 state_err_tmp_1 = 1 OR //err rough_leak set
Bit 0 state_err_tmp_2 = 1 // err rough_leak_refu set
Then(3) LV_FUC_OPEN_DET = 1
T_ACT_FUC_OPEN = C_T_ACT_FUC_OPEN
Else(3) LV_FUC_OPEN_DET = 0
T_ACT_FUC_OPEN = 0
Endif(3)
Endif(2)
Else(1)
LV_FUC_OPEN_DET = 0
T_ACT_FUC_OPEN = 0
Endif(1)
// *** Final output flag for lamp illumination in dashboard ***
// After driving cycle start (LV_OBD_ST = 1) and key-on, the
// fuel-cap-open lamp will be illuminated for C_T_ACT_FUC_OPEN sec ...
// over all cumulated driving cycles till T_ACT_FUC_OPEN = 0 sec;

37.14.1 Rate Based Monitoring calculation for DMTLM
� General Information
Within this subchapter the rate based monitoring calculation for DMTLM is performed. For each DMTL diag-
nostic instance, so for DMTL_MAX, DMTL_MIN, DMTL_PLAUS and DMTL_SIG, the calculation is done.
The numerator is incremented, when the diagnostic has ended with or without error, so end_diag ?ag set.
The calculation is locked when an error has occurred that might lead to inconsistent results.
The denominator is increased when cold start conditions were given, engine has run long enough and ambient
temperature were within the necessary OBD range.(->LV_DC_CDN_CST_RBM)
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: at ECU reset: STATE_RBM_DMTL_MAX/MIN/PLAUS/SIG = 0
Activation: LV_CONF_DMTL = 1 AND LV_FID_READY = 1
Recurrence: 100 ms
� Function Description
/*Generation of Bit 0 = Incrementation of Numerator*/
If(1) bit 1 of STATE_RBM_DMTL_MAX = 0 AND
LV_DMTL_ASA = 0
Then(1)
If(2a) bit 0 of STATE_RBM_DMTL_MAX = 0
Then(2a)//if end-diag (=Bit 5) set then RBM counter is incremented
If(3) Bit 5 of ACTION_ERRM_GetErrmStatus(NC_IDX_ERR_DMTL_MAX)= 1
Then(3)bit 0 of STATE_RBM_DMTL_MAX = 1
ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorNumFor(NC_IDX_RBM_DMTL_MAX)
Endif(3)
Endif(2a)
If(2b) bit 0 of STATE_RBM_DMTL_MIN = 0
Then(2b)//if end-diag set then RBM counter is incremented
If(3) Bit 5 of ACTION_ERRM_GetErrmStatus(NC_IDX_ERR_DMTL_MIN)= 1
Then(3)bit 0 of STATE_RBM_DMTL_MIN = 1
ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorNumFor(NC_IDX_RBM_DMTL_MIN)
Endif(3)
Endif(2b)
If(2c) bit 0 of STATE_RBM_DMTL_PLAUS = 0
Then(2c)//if end-diag set then RBM counter is incremented
If(3) Bit 5 of ACTION_ERRM_GetErrmStatus(NC_IDX_ERR_DMTL_PLAUS)= 1
Then(3)bit 0 of STATE_RBM_DMTL_PLAUS = 1
ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorNumFor(NC_IDX_RBM_DMTL_PLAUS)
Endif(3)
Endif(2c)

Then(2d)//if end-diag set then RBM counter is incremented

EVAM, Rate based monitoring for leakage detection pump function
37.14.2 Rate Based Monitroing Calculation for ROUGH_LEAK
� General Information
Within this subchapter the rate based monitoring calculation for ROUGH_LEAK is performed.
For more information concerning the increasing of numerator, denominator and locking of calculation, see
RBM calculation for DMTL.
Important: A requirement for OBD relevant RBM calculations is the fact, that the increase of the numerator for
the non-failure case must not happen earlier than for the failure case. To accomplish this a delay timer is
incremented when the non-failure case is ?nished. If the timer exceeds the maximum possible diagnostic
duration time for rough_leak, a ?ag is set and used to increase the numerator.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: at ECU reset:
STATE_RBM_ROUGH_LEAK = 0
at igkoff2on and rst:
LV_DET_NO_ROUGH_LEAK = 0
LV_DET_ROUGH_LEAK = 0
LV_DET_ROUGH_LEAK_VIRT = 0
T_DET_ROUGH_LEAK_VIRT = 0
Activation: LV_CONF_DMTL = 1 AND LV_FID_READY = 1
Recurrence: 100 ms
� Function Description
If LV_ERR_DET_ROUGH_LEAK_MIN = 0 AND // non-failure case
LV_CYC_ROUGH_LEAK_MODE6 = 1 AND
LV_DMTL_ASA = 0
Then LV_DET_NO_ROUGH_LEAK = 1
LV_DET_ROUGH_LEAK = 0
Endif
If LV_ERR_DET_ROUGH_LEAK_MIN = 1 AND // failure case
LV_CYC_ROUGH_LEAK_MODE6 = 1 AND
LV_DMTL_ASA = 0
Then LV_DET_ROUGH_LEAK = 1
LV_DET_NO_ROUGH_LEAK = 0
Endif
/*Delay timer for ?same-time? numerator increase in failure and non-failure case
for rough_leak*/
If LV_DET_NO_ROUGH_LEAK = 1
Then
If T_DET_ROUGH_LEAK_VIRT = 0
Then T_DET_ROUGH_LEAK_VIRT = T_ACT_LEAK_MES
Else T_DET_ROUGH_LEAK_VIRT = T_DET_ROUGH_LEAK_VIRT + 0.1s
If T_DET_ROUGH_LEAK_VIRT > C_T_ACT_ROUGH_LEAK_MAX
Then LV_DET_ROUGH_LEAK_VIRT = 1
Endif
Endif
Endif

/*Generation of Bit 0 = Incrementation of Numerator*/
If bit 0 of STATE_RBM_ROUGH_LEAK = 0
Then
If LV_DET_ROUGH_LEAK_VIRT = 1 OR
LV_DET_ROUGH_LEAK = 1
Then bit 0 of STATE_RBM_ROUGH_LEAK = 1
ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorNumFor(NC_IDX_RBM_ROUGH_LEAK)
LV_DET_NO_ROUGH_LEAK = 0
LV_DET_ROUGH_LEAK = 0
Endif
Endif
/*Check for errors to lock RBM calculation and to set Bit 1*/
If bit 1 of STATE_RBM_ROUGH_LEAK = 0
Then
If !ACTION_FARM_GetPermission (NC_FID_ENA_LEAK_DMTL)
Then bit 1 of STATE_RBM_ROUGH_LEAK = 1
ACTION_ERRM_LockRbmMonitorFor(NC_IDX_RBM_ROUGH_LEAK)
Endif
Endif
/*Check for OBD-environmental(TAM, TCO_ST and T_AST) conditions to increase denominator
and to set Bit 2*/
If bit 2 of STATE_RBM_ROUGH_LEAK = 0
Then
If LV_DC_CDN_CST_RBM = 1
Then bit 2 of STATE_RBM_ROUGH_LEAK = 1
ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorDenFor(NC_IDX_RBM_ROUGH_LEAK)
Endif
Endif
37.14.3 Rate Based Monitoring Calculation for Small Leak
� General Information
Within this subchapter the rate based monitoring calculation for SMALL_LEAK is performed.
For more information concerning the increasing of numerator, denominator and locking of calculation, see
RBM calculation for DMTL.
Important: A requirement for OBD relevant RBM calculations is the fact, that the increase of the numerator for
the non-failure case must not happen earlier than for the failure case. To accomplish this a delay timer is
incremented when the non-failure case is ?nished. If the timer exceeds the maximum possible diagnostic
duration time for small_leak, a ?ag is set and used to increase the numerator.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: at ECU reset:
STATE_RBM_SMALL_LEAK = 0
at igkoff2on and rst:
LV_DET_NO_SMALL_LEAK = 0
LV_DET_SMALL_LEAK = 0
LV_DET_SMALL_LEAK_VIRT = 0
T_DET_SMALL_LEAK_VIRT = 0

EVAM, Rate based monitoring for leakage detection pump function
Activation: LV_CONF_DMTL = 1 AND LV_FID_READY = 1
Recurrence: 100 ms
� Function Description
If LV_ERR_DET_SMALL_LEAK_MIN = 1 AND //failure case
LV_CYC_SMALL_LEAK_MODE6 = 1 AND
LV_DMTL_ASA = 0
Then LV_DET_SMALL_LEAK = 1
LV_DET_NO_SMALL_LEAK = 0
Endif
If LV_ERR_DET_SMALL_LEAK_MIN = 0 AND //non-failure case
LV_CYC_SMALL_LEAK_MODE6 = 1 AND
LV_DMTL_ASA = 0
Then LV_DET_NO_SMALL_LEAK = 1
LV_DET_SMALL_LEAK = 0
Endif
/*Delay timer for ?same-time? numerator increase in failure and non-failure case
for small_leak*/
If LV_DET_NO_SMALL_LEAK = 1
Then
If T_DET_SMALL_LEAK_VIRT = 0
Then T_DET_SMALL_LEAK_VIRT = T_ACT_LEAK_MES
Else T_DET_SMALL_LEAK_VIRT = T_DET_SMALL_LEAK_VIRT + 0.1s
If T_DET_SMALL_LEAK_VIRT > C_T_ACT_LEAK_MES_MAX
Then LV_DET_SMALL_LEAK_VIRT = 1
Endif
Endif
Endif
/*Generation of Bit 0 = Incrementation of Numerator*/
If bit 0 of STATE_RBM_SMALL_LEAK = 0
Then
If LV_DET_SMALL_LEAK = 1 OR
LV_DET_SMALL_LEAK_VIRT = 1
Then bit 0 of STATE_RBM_SMALL_LEAK = 1
ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorNumFor(NC_IDX_RBM_SMALL_LEAK)
LV_DET_SMALL_LEAK = 0
LV_DET_NO_SMALL_LEAK = 0
Endif
Endif
/*Check for errors to lock RBM calculation and to set Bit 1*/
If bit 1 of STATE_RBM_SMALL_LEAK = 0
Then
If !ACTION_FARM_GetPermission (NC_FID_ENA_LEAK_DMTL)
Then bit 1 of STATE_RBM_SMALL_LEAK = 1
ACTION_ERRM_LockRbmMonitorFor(NC_IDX_RBM_SMALL_LEAK)
Endif
Endif
/*Check for OBD-environmental(TAM, TCO_ST and T_AST) conditions to increase denominator
and to set Bit 2*/
If bit 2 of STATE_RBM_SMALL_LEAK = 0
Then
If LV_DC_CDN_CST_RBM = 1
Then bit 2 of STATE_RBM_SMALL_LEAK = 1
ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorDenFor(NC_IDX_RBM_SMALL_LEAK)
Endif
Endif

� General Information
This module collects the diagnostic information of the NVLD small leak, electrical and mechanical switch, smart
module reset, timer, ambient temperature and communication error symptoms. The data is then passed to
the error management aggregate.

Figure 37.15.24:
37.15.2.2.1.1 Condition for small leak error detection
The small leak diagnostic is done during NVLD "diagnostic mode". The results are transmitted to the ECU on
next engine running phase.
In case conditions were not full?lled, a cnl bit is set (lv_diag_small_leak_cnl) and therefore no diagnostic result
is entried. Also, this cnl-bit is set after a successful diagnosis followed by a key-off, key-on and engine start, to
avoid multiple diagnostics.
The diagnostic evaluatoin takes place during state_nvld = "small_leak_diag" (lv_diag_small_leak_act_nvld = 1).

Figure 37.15.25:
37.15.2.2.1.2 Condition for mechanical NVLDII switch error detection
The mechanical switch diagnostic is divided into a diagnostic for Turbo engines and non-turbo engines. The
distinction is done by the switch lc_inh_swi_diag_pwl_nvld.
The diagnostic for Turbo engines runs during NVLD "diagnostic mode". The result is transmitted on next
engine start to the ECU. When lv_act_swi_diag_nvld is active, typically during state_nvld = "small_leak_diag" the
diagnostic is done.
The diagnostic for non-turbo engines runs either in state_nvld = "complete_diag" (lv_diag_cmpl_act = 1) or in
PWL when engine is turned off. During "complete_diag" the diagnostic can only run if switch was open at
engine start and switch closes during purging. In PWL the diagnostic runs all the time the swich was deteced
as closed.

37.15.2.2.1.3 Condition for electrical NVLDII switch error detection
The diagnostic for the swi-el runs when engine is running and state_nvld is not in "ERROR" (smaller than "er-
ror").
After engine start, when state_nvld = "tam_swi_diag", the swi_el diagnostic is done once for the past NVLD
diagnostic phase.
While engine is running, the swi_el diagnosis runs with a c_t_swi_el_con_nvld recurrence (typically 30 sec).
(fore more details see swi_el_nvld diagnostic spec)

SMT_RST failure is set.
The lv_diag_rst_smt_cnl is there, to avoid multpile failure entries after key-off, key-on engine start transitions.
(fore more details see SMT_RST diagnostic spec in NVLD core specs)

Figure 37.15.31:
37.15.2.2.1.6 Conditions for smart-module temperature sensor error symptoms detection
The TAM_SMT_PLAUS diagnostic runs once, every time the ECU starts from a normal reset.
The diagnostic is done during state_nvld = "tam_Swi_Diag", or, in case of cold start, the diagnostic is done when
lv_cdn_rng_l_nvld is set (for more details, see actual NVLD TAM_SMT diagnostic spec.)
The TAM_SMT_RNG_H diagnostic runs on the one hand once, every time the ECU starts from a normal reset.
The diagnostic is done during state_nvld = "tam_Swi_Diag".
On the other hand, the diagnostic also runs constantly during engine running with the same recurrence like
swi_el.
The TAM_SMT_RNG_L and TAM_SMT_CHK diagnostic runs once, every time the ECU starts from a normal
reset with a cold start.
The diagnostic is done as soon as lv_cdn_rng_l_nvld is set. This can already be the case during state_nvld =
"tam_Swi_Diag", or later (for more details and special conditions, see actual NVLD TAM_SMT diagnostic spec.)

� General Information
FUNCTION DESCRIPTION
This module is divided into seven parts:
- RBM interface for ?Small Leak? (0,5 Leak and 6�C temperature difference)
- RBM interface for ?Small Leak? (0,5 Leak and 8�C temperature difference)
- RBM interface for ?Switch diagnosis"
- RBM interface for TAM_SMT_CHK (crosscheck TAM_SMT sensor)
- RBM interface for TAM_SMT_RNG_L (Range-low check for TAM_SMT sensor)
- Service 06h
- MVB status of NVLD switch
37.16.1 RBM interface for ?Small Leak? (0,5 Leak and 6�C temperature difference)
� General Information
With this module the interface between the EVAP Small Leakage failure with 6�C temperature difference and
the Rate-Based Monitoring statistics is de?ned with STATE_RBM_EVAP_1 data.
Within STATE_RBM_EVAP_1 three different information are de?ned:
Information about bit 0 of STATE_RBM_EVAP_1:
Conditions for monitoring are met long enough to detect malfunction. The conditions for setting Bit 0 of
NVLD small leak diagnosis are:
a) Small leak diagnosis ?nished
b) Small leak diagnosis was not cancelled (due to the non-presence of conditions)
c) 6�C condition was present
d) Difference of AMP at system stop and AMP at system start smaller than a threshold
e) AMP sensor not faulty
Information about bit 1 of STATE_RBM_EVAP_1:
Monitor disabled because of system malfunction
Information about bit 2 of STATE_RBM_EVAP_1:
Cold start RBM conditions encountered within this DC
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: at ECU reset:
STATE_RBM_EVAP_1 = 0 (all Bits)
on failure memory reset :
bit 1 of STATE_RBM_EVAP_1 = 0

EVAM, Evaporative system monitoring error interface for NVLD (Appl. Inc.)
Activation: LV_FID_READY = 1
Recurrence: 1 sec
� Function Description
If bit 0 of STATE_RBM_EVAP_1 = 0 (Numerator increment condition)
then
ACTION_ERRM_GetErrmStatus(IN<NC_IDX_ERR_SMALL_LEAK_NVLD>,
OUT<STATE_ERR_SMALL_LEAK_NVLD>)
if Bit 5 of STATE_ERR_SMALL_LEAK_NVLD = 1 //end flag set
and LV_DIAG_SMALL_LEAK_CNL = 0 (Diagnosis is not cancelled)
and LV_DIAG_SMT_CDN_6_NVLD = 1 ( 6�C condition fulfilled)
and[(AMP_STOP_SMALL_LEAK_NVLD - AMP_ST_SMALL_LEAK_NVLD) <
C_AMP_DIF_SMALL_LEAK
and LV_AMP_VLD_NVLD = 1]
then bit 0 of STATE_RBM_EVAP_1 = 1
ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorNumFor(NC_IDX_RBM_EVAP_1)
endif
endif
If bit 1 of STATE_RBM_EVAP_1 = 0
then
if LV_INH_RBM_EVAP_LEAK = 1 (Small leak diag. inhibited)
then bit 1 of STATE_RBM_EVAP_1 = 1
ACTION_ERRM_LockRbmMonitorFor(NC_IDX_RBM_EVAP_1)
endif
Endif
If bit 2 of STATE_RBM_EVAP_1 = 0
then
if LV_DC_CDN_CST_RBM = 1 (cold start conditions given)
then bit 2 of STATE_RBM_EVAP_1 = 1
ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorDenFor(NC_IDX_RBM_EVAP_1)
endif
Endif

37.16.6 Service 06h
� General Information
Service 06h : This part is used to provide Mode6 values from a valid small leak diagnosis to the scan tool.
Mode6 values consist of the current measured diagnostic value and the minimum and maximum value
that is possible. For NVLD small leak diagnosis the relevant parameter is the closing time of the switch.
Conversion of data types are necessary to match Service 06h data types as required in SAE J1979 / ISO
15031-5
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: on transition LV_IGK OFF- > ON or reset :
All Outputs are set with saved value, other variables are set
to 0.
LV_NVLD_SAE_LEAK_END = 0 only at RST, not at IGKON
on failure memory clear
All values including saved values has to be reset to 0
Activation: LV_IGK = 1
Deactivation: LV_IGK = 0
Recurrence: 1 sec

In order to be able to use NVLD aggregate Core modules for more projects, this application incidences speci-

de?nitions from project to project. To avoid modi?cation work in the Core, small and quick changes can be
done in this module in case a de?nition of an input needs to be modi?ed.

� Function Description
37.17.2.1 Calculation of project speci?c input parameters for NVLD diagnosis
/*To signalize to the NVLD core functionality that a valid engine start has
occurred, the flag lv_st_end_nvld is generated. This flag is the trigger to
start the state machine (STATE_NVLD) ?cycle?. This bit must not be reset on lv_
st_end = 0!*/
If LV_ST_END == 1
Then LV_ST_END_NVLD = 1
Endif
/** TAM_SMT_ST calculation **/
/*In order to know the NVLD temperature sensor value at engine start, this
information is collected from the NVLD module and copied onto TAM_STM_ST_NVLD
*/
If LV_TAM_SWI_DIAG_END_NVLD == 0
Then
If LV_TAM_SMT_VLD_NVLD == 1
Then TAM_SMT_ST_NVLD = TAM_SMT_NVLD
LV_TAM_SMT_ST_VLD_NVLD = 1
Endif
Endif

/** Determination of LV_DIAG_SMT_VLD_NVLD **/
If STATE_NVLD == OFF AND
LV_DIAG_T_SMT_END = 1
Then LV_DIAG_SMT_VLD_NVLD = LV_DIAG_SMT_ST_END
Else
If STATE_NVLD == SLEEP
Then LV_DIAG_SMT_VLD_NVLD = LV_DIAG_SMT_STOP_END
Else
IF LV_INH_DIAG_SMALL_LEAK_NVLD = 1 OR
LV_DIAG_SMALL_LEAK_CNL = 1 OR
LV_DIAG_SMALL_LEAK_END = 1
Then LV_DIAG_SMT_VLD_NVLD = 0
Else
IF LC_DIAG_SMT_VLD_NVLD_MAN = 1
THEN LV_DIAG_SMT_VLD_NVLD = 1
ENDIF
Endif
Endif
Endif
/** Cold start detection **/
If (LV_CST_DET_CMPL == 1 and LV_TEMP_COLD == 1) or
LC_CST_DET_NVLD_MAN = 1
Then LV_CST_DET_NVLD = 1
Else LV_CST_DET_NVLD = 0
Endif
/** Condition for signal out of range low and cross-check determination on
cold start **/
If ACTION_FARM_GetPermission( NC_FID_ERR_RNG_L_NVLD) or
LC_CDN_RNG_L_MAN_NVLD == 1
Then LV_CDN_RNG_L_NVLD = 1
Else LV_CDN_RNG_L_NVLD = 0
Endif
/** Intake air temperature sensor value for smart module sens. diag. **/
#IF NC_TIA_CONF = 31
#THEN TIA_MES_DIAGCP = TIA_MES[NC_IDX_TIA_AM_SCHA]
#ENDIF
#IF NC_TIA_CONF = 10
#THEN TIA_MES_DIAGCP = TIA_MES[NC_IDX_TIA_IM_CYL]
#ENDIF

/** Battery voltage condition for NVLD state machine **/
IFLV_VB_CDN_NVLD = 0
THEN
T_DLY_VB_CDN_NVLD_NOT_VLD = T_DLY_VB_CDN_NVLD_NOT_VLD - 100 ms
IF T_DLY_VB_CDN_NVLD_NOT_VLD == 0
THEN LV_VB_CDN_NVLD_VLD = 0
ENDIF
ELSE
LV_VB_CDN_NVLD_VLD = 1
T_DLY_VB_CDN_NOT_VLD = C_T_DLY_VB_CDN_NVLD_NOT_VLD
ENDIF
/** Check whether AMP sensor is defective **/
*/The AMP-sensor validity is checked at the end of power latch (- -> see init
section). This needs to be done, because on next driving cycle it needs to
be checked whether the AMP sensor status was OK before the start of the diagnostic
phase and therefore the value from the sensor was trustable.
When the new driving cycle starts, it is also checked if the value from the
AMP-sensor is still valid - see code below -, so that possible defects that
happened during the diagnostic phase can be considered in order to use or to
not use the small leak diagnostic results from the last diagnostic phase*/
IF LV_FID_READY = 1 and LV_IGK = 1
THEN
IF LV_AMP_VLD_NVLD = 1
THEN ACTION_FARM_GetPermission(NC_FID_ERR_AMP_NVLD)
IF LV_PRMS = 1
THEN LV_AMP_VLD_NVLD = 1
ELSE LV_AMP_VLD_NVLD = 0
ENDIF
ENDIF
ENDIF
/** Definition of valid fuel tank level signal:**/
IF LV_ST_END_NVLD = 1 AND
LC_DIAG_FTL_INH = 0
THEN
IF T_DLY_FTL_CHK_NVLD = 0
THEN
IF !ACTION_FARM_GetPermission( NC_FID_ERR_FTL_NVLD)
Then LV_FTL_NOT_VLD_NVLD = 1 //FTL not valid due to err.
ELSE
If FTL_CAN_REL =< C_FTL_MAX_NVLD AND
(LV_FTL_CAN_VLD = 1 OR
FTL_CAN <> phys.max. )
Then LV_FTL_NOT_VLD_NVLD = 0 //ftl below thd.
ELSE LV_FTL_NOT_VLD_NVLD = 1
Endif
Endif
ELSE T_DLY_FTL_CHK_NVLD = T_DLY_FTL_CHK_NVLD - 100 ms
ENDIF
ELSE
LV_FTL_NOT_VLD_NVLD = 0
T_DLY_FTL_CHK_NVLD = C_T_DLY_FTL_CHK_NVLD
ENDIF

37.17.2.2 Calculation of NVLD diagnosis inhibition ?ags
/** NVLD switch check inhibition **/
If (!ACTION_FARM_GetPermission( NC_FID_ERR_SWI_NVLD) and
LV_FID_READY = 1 ) or
LV_INH_DIAG_SWI_NVLD_NVMY = 1
Then LV_INH_DIAG_SWI_NVLD = 1
Endif
If !ACTION_FARM_GetPermission( NC_FID_ERR_DIAG_NVLD) AND
LV_FID_READY = 1
Then LV_INH_DIAG_NVLD = 1 //used to set the state machine to "err"
Else LV_INH_DIAG_NVLD = 0
Endif
/** Small leak diagnosis discarded (due to present errors)**/
If (!ACTION_FARM_GetPermission( NC_FID_ERR_DIAG_SMALL_LEAK_NVLD) and
LV_FID_READY = 1) or
LV_INH_REQ_DIAG_NVLD = 1
Then LV_INH_DIAG_SMALL_LEAK_NVLD = 1
LV_INH_RBM_EVAP_LEAK = 1
Else
If LV_FTL_NOT_VLD_NVLD = 1
Then LV_INH_DIAG_SMALL_LEAK_NVLD = 1
Endif
Endif
/** Small leak & mechanical switch diagnosis not requested due to ...**/
a)errors at the end of last DC which can not be detected by NVLD itself
and which are evaluated next DC
( - -> LV_INH_REQ_DIAG_NVLD is memorized in NVMY )
b)lv_small_leak_diag_vld_nvld is used to sent the NVLD to sleep.
Info: to make spec compatible between turbo and non-turbo engines, a
distinction is made with a switch (Note: Turbo engines need diagnostic
NVLD phase. Otherwise a swi_nvld error can not be confirmed. Therefore
no sleep request in case of swi_nvld error with turbo engines.)
If(1)( T_PWL > C_T_PWL_MIN_CHK_NVLD_DIAG OR
(T_PWL > 0 and LV_DIAG_SMALL_LEAK_END = 1) ) AND
LV_ECU_RST_DET_NVLD = 0
Then(1)
If(2) !ACTION_FARM_GetPermission(NC_FID_REQ_DIAG_NVLD)
Then(2)
LV_INH_REQ_DIAG_NVLD = 1
LV_INH_DIAG_SWI_NVLD_NVMY = 1
Else(2)
ACTION_ERRM_GetErrmStatus(IN<NC_IDX_ERR_SWI_NVLD>,
OUT<STATE_ERR_SWI_NVLD>)
IF(3) Bit 0 of STATE_ERR_SWI_NVLD = 1 AND
LC_INH_SWI_DIAG_PWL_NVLD = 0
THEN(3) LV_INH_REQ_DIAG_NVLD = 1

ELSE(3) LV_INH_REQ_DIAG_NVLD = 0
ENDIF(3)
LV_INH_DIAG_SWI_NVLD_NVMY = 0
Endif(2)
Endif(1)
/** TAM_SMT diagnosis inhibition **/
Note: The inhibition of tam_smt_rng_l by tam_smt_rng_h is done within the
structure of the basic TAM_NVLD-diagnostic specification.
The same is valid for tam_smt_plaus (rng_h and rng_l lock here) and tam_smt_
chk_nvld (rng_h, rng_l and plaus lock here).
If !ACTION_FARM_GetPermission( NC_FID_ERR_DIAG_TAM_SMT_NVLD) and
LV_FID_READY = 1
Then LV_INH_DIAG_TAM_SMT_CHK_NVLD = 1
LV_INH_DIAG_TAM_SMT_NVLD = 1 /*inh-flag for rng_l/h & tam_plaus*/
ELSE
IF !ACTION_FARM_GetPermission(NC_FID_ERR_DIAG_TAM_SMT_CHK_NVLD)
and LV_FID_READY = 1
THEN
LV_INH_DIAG_TAM_SMT_CHK_NVLD = 1
ENDIF
Endif
/** Timer T_SMT_NVLD diagnosis inhibition **/
If !ACTION_FARM_GetPermission( NC_FID_ERR_DIAG_T_SMT_NVLD) and
LV_FID_READY = 1
Then LV_INH_DIAG_T_SMT_NVLD= 1
Endif
/** SMT reset detection diagnosis inhibition **/
IF !ACTION_FARM_GetPermission( NC_FID_ERR_DIAG_SMT_RST_NVLD) and
LV_FID_READY = 1
THEN LV_INH_DIAG_SMT_RST_NVLD = 1
Endif
/** NVLD switch electrical diagnosis inhibition **/
IF !ACTION_FARM_GetPermission( NC_FID_ERR_DIAG_SWI_EL_NVLD) and
LV_FID_READY = 1
THEN LV_INH_DIAG_SWI_EL_NVLD = 1
Endif

37.17.3 Communication inhibition ?ag LV_INH_SMT_COMC_NVLD (10ms)
� General Information
Calculation of NVLD communication inhibition ?ag.
The inhibition ?ag is used to stop the communication between NVLD and ECU in case electrical errors have
been occurred on the communication line or internal NVLD communication errors have occurred.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: on clr_fmy, igkoff2on and rst:
LV_INH_SMT_COMC_NVLD = 0
Activation: always
Recurrence: 10 ms
� Function Description
/** Inhibition flag due to communication error **/
Important:10ms function call for calculation of lv_inh_smt_comc_nvld in software has
to happen in between "evam_sigdgsmtnvld0__10ms" and "evam_reqcoscom0__10ms"
IF LV_FID_READY = 1
THEN
IF !ACTION_FARM_GetPermission( NC_FID_ERR_SMT_COMC_NVLD)
THEN LV_INH_SMT_COMC_NVLD = 1
ELSE LV_INH_SMT_COMC_NVLD = 0
ENDIF
ENDIF

a ?ller cap open illumination is only possible on the ?rst error detection. In case the error is con?rmed, the ?ller
cap illumination lamp is turned off (LV_DISP_FUC_WARN_CAN = 0) and the MIL is turned on instead.
The duration of illumination is de?ned with T_ACT_FUC_OPEN_NVLD.

// Get error Status from ERRM of SMALL_LEAK_NVLD
state_err_tmp = ACTION_ERRM_GetErrmStatus(<NC_IDX_ERR_SMALL_LEAK_NVLD>)
// Check, whether small leak error has been confirmed
If LC_SMALL_LEAK_NVLD_NOT_CFM_MAN = 0
Then
tmp_SmallLeakStatusFlag = 0h
ACTION_ERRM_GetErrMem(NC_IDX_ERR_SMALL_LEAK_NVLD, PRM_LV_ERR_MEM)
// Check if small-leak failure is in dynamic memory
// if not, respective bits stay on zero
If PRM_LV_ERR_MEM = 1
Then
For IDX_DYN = 0 to CTR_ERR_DYN_NR-1
If (DIAG_INST[IDX_DYN] = PRM_IDX_ERR_SMALL_LEAK_NVLD) AND
LV_ERR_MKD[IDX_DYN] = 0
Then
// Confirmed DTC for small_leak
tmp_SmallLeakStatusFlag = LV_ERR_CFM[IDX_DYN]
Endif
EndFor
Endif
Else
tmp_SmallLeakStatusFlag = 0h
Endif
// *** Fuel cap open detection logic ***
// Fuel cap open detection is valid (LV_FUC_OPEN_DET_NVLD = 1) if
// SMALL_LEAK error is detected and not yet confirmed
If(1) tmp_SmallLeakStatusFlag = 0 // small failure not confirmed
Then(1)
If(2) Bit 5 of state_err_tmp = 1 //small_leak end set
Then(2)
If(3) Bit 0 state_err_tmp = 1 //err small_leak set
Then(3)
If(4) LV_FUC_OPEN_DET_NVLD = 0
Then(4)
LV_FUC_OPEN_DET_NVLD = 1
T_ACT_FUC_OPEN_NVLD = C_T_ACT_FUC_OPEN_NVLD
Endif(4)
Else(3) LV_FUC_OPEN_DET_NVLD = 0
T_ACT_FUC_OPEN_NVLD = 0
Endif(3)
Endif(2)
Else(1)
LV_FUC_OPEN_DET_NVLD = 0
T_ACT_FUC_OPEN_NVLD = 0
Endif(1)

37.18.2.2.1 Powerlatch valve control
If the switch was closed at engine start, during the powerlatch phase the CPS valve is opened via a ramp until
a maximum threshold is reached and the control timer has elapsed. The timer only starts if the maximum ?ow
threshold is reached. (Timer is limited to 50 s to avoid to long switch check diagnosis)

ful?l an exact sequencing which is handled by the NVLD state machine. The calling of diagnosis modules is
handled by activation ?ags. As response end ?ags are set. This indicates that the activated and called module

37.20.2.2.2.4.1.1 Smart module Electrical diagnosis from diagnostic mode phase
To get the Smart module Electrical diagnosis results from diagnostic mode the switch electrical request is sent.
When all necessary information from the diagnosis phase is read out, the diagnostic end.and the INI request
is sent to smart module to switch to current electrical value. The switch electrical request during TAM_SWI_
DIAG is then cancelled until next start of Smart module diagnostic mode.

37.20.2.2.2.11 SLEEP
37.20.2.2.2.11.1 Request smart module sleep mode
If ambient pressure or temperature are below minimum thresholds, or some other errors lead to lv_inh_req_
diag_nvld setting which activated lv_sleep_act_nvld in pwl, no engine off diagnosis is possible and therefore the
smart module is requested to go into sleep mode, i.e. without performing the temperature and switch position
monitoring.

37.20.2.2.2.12.2 End of line diagnosis for NVLD

values via INI and SWI-EL request. Finally the switch position, the temperature and the electrical error for the
switch will be determined.

Delay time for AMP_ST learning by NVLD

� Import actions:
ACTION_ECME_WriteOnFly(IN <CH_IDX>)
ACTION_FCTM_HoldPwlPhase(IN <PRM_IDX_PWL_LOCK_CDN>)
ACTION_FCTM_ReleasePwlPhase(IN <PRM_IDX_PWL_LOCK_CDN>)
� General Information
In this module, the following NVLD diagnostics checks are performed:
- NVLD timer check in power latch to check the synchronization between NVLD and ECU time
- Switch check during power latch, ?SMALL_LEAK? and ?COMPL_DIAG?
- Small leak
Moreover, the necessary power latch extension request for the switch and timer check is accomplished within
this module.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: RST, CLRFMY, IGKON, NVMRES, NVMINI, NVMSTO, PWLOFF
Activation: always
Deactivation: never
Recurrence: 100MS

Figure 37.21.7:
37.21.2 Operations of the 100ms task
The system is divided into two different functionalities. The "Small leak diagnosis" and partly the "switch_check"
are executed during engine on, whereas the "Smart module timer diagnosis and PWL switch check" is done
after engine stop during the powerlatch phase.
Furthermore a reset (OFF_RESET) of the onlinedata is done when the smart module is sent to sleep or diag-
nostic mode.

37.21.2.1 Power latch locking
If ignition key is turned off, power latch is locked in case conditions are ful?lled (LV_NVLD_PWL_LOCK = 1).
In case the conditions are no longer ful?lled, a delay timer starts counting down (C_T_DLY_NVLD_PWL_LOCK).
If this timer has elapsed, the power latch lock ?ag, and therefore the power latch, is reset.

latch or due to the setting of the communication cancel ?ag (due to for example low battery voltage during
power latch).

37.21.2.3 Memorization of AMP_ST_SMALL_LEAK_NVLD
The ambient pressure at start is memorized. Later on, when the small leak results from NVLD are evaluated, it
is analyzed. For a valid evaluation of the small leak results from the NVLD the difference between AMP at start
and AMP at Stop, so the ambient pressure at end of power latch before the beginning of the diagnostic phase,
must not be too high. See chapter "Determination of diagnostic result" for further usage.

37.21.2.4 Small leak diagnosis
37.21.2.4.1 Determination of diagnostic result
The small leak diagnosis is using information from the smart module from last engine off cycle.
Preconditions to evaluate the small leak results from the NVLD module are a stable ambient pressure before
and after the diagnostic phase (AMP_CDN) and a valid ambient temperature decrease of 6�C or 8�C (SMT_
CDN). Also, no small leak affecting system errors must be present (LV_INH_DIAG_SMALL_LEAK_NVLD = 0)
and smart module must have been correctly send to OFF-Mode (LV_DIAG_SMT_VLD_NVLD = 1). Nevertheless,

Figure 37.21.22:
37.21.2.5 Switch position detection and switch diagnosis
The NVLD switch check is functionally subdivided into several blocks:
- Block SWI_PSN_REQ: Depending on the input variables, the switch position is requested from the NVLD mod-
ule.
- Block DIAG_MOD_SWI_CHK: For vehicles with turbo engines, the switch check is done during engine running
phase,
- Block CMPL_SWI_CHK: This check is done during engine running phase, when state machine STATE_NVLD is
in "COMPL_DIAG" and switch was open at engine start and closed during e.g. canister purging.
- Block PWL_SWI_CHK: For vehicles with non-turbo engines, the switch check is done during power latch if the
switch was closed at engine start or was open and closed during engine running phase. That means, that this
test can not be performed with a switch open from engine start to engine stop.

Figure 37.21.30:
37.21.2.5.4 Powerlatch switch rationality check
If the switch was closed at the start of the driving cycle, no system errors were detected and engine con-
?guration is non-turbo (lc_inh_swi_diag_pwl_nvld = 0), the rationality of the switch has to be checked during
the powerlatch phase. The diagnosis is opening the CPS valve via PWM (see LV_REQ_PWL_SWI_DIAG_NVLD
generating CPPWM_SP_CPS_NVLD) and monitoring the switch position.
This request is set, if the start time for the timer diagnosis has been memorized.
If the switch is still closed and maximum time has elapsed switch error is detected. If the switch is opening due
to the ?ow through the opened CPS valve the system is detected as OK.

37.21.2.5.4.1 Determination of diagnostic result
Result interpretation for the switch check in power latch:
a) if the switch opened, signalized by the falling edge of LV_DIAG_SWT_SWI_AV_NVLD or the setting of the ?ag
LV_DIAG_SMT_SWI_TRAN_NVLD, then the non-failure case is performed
b) if the switch was open all the time, so LV_DIAG_SMT_SWI_AV_NVLD = 0, then a switch check in power latch
is not possible
c) if a) and b) were not true, then the error case is performed

Figure 37.21.35:
37.21.2.6 Smart module timer diagnosis
If the ignition is turned off, the smart module timer diagnosis is performed. The diagnosis is done in the
following way:
- Block REQ_T_SMT: A bit for the request of timer values from the NVLD module is generated if inputs ful?lled
- Block CLC_T_REF: A reference timer in the ECU is started
- Block MEM_T_ST: The received time value from NVLD after the ?rst request, so the NVLD timer value at timer
diagnosis start, is memorized
- Block MEM_T_STOP: After a certain time in power latch, the NVLD time is again request (see Block REQ_T_
SMT) and the received time value is memorized
- Block DIAG_T_SMT: The memorized NVLD stop and start times are compared to the reference time value
from the ECU. If the difference is within calibration limits, then the timer is declared as ok.

� General Information
The NVLD module is equipped with a ambient temperature sensor that measures the temperature close
to the tank. Before the TAM value from NVLD (TAM_SMT_NVLD) can be declared as trustworthy, electrical and
plausible checks for this NVLD TAM sensor have to be performed.
In case errors are detected on the TAM_SMT_NVLD sensor, the small leak diagnosis results are discarded (- >
LV_INH_DIAG_SMALL_LEAK_NVLD = 1) to avoid wrong leak detection results.
For the NVLD TAM sensor there are four diagnostics available.
a) TAM_SMT_RNG_H: Temperature value out-of-range high diagnostic
b) TAM_SMT_RNG_L: Temperature value out-of-range low diagnostic
c) TAM_SMT_PLAUS: Temperature value plausible failure
d) TAM_SMT_CHK: Temperature cross check
Generally:
TAM_SMT_RNG_H, TAM_SMT_RNG_L and TAM_SMT_PLAUS monitoring is done when NVLD is in diagnostic
mode, whereas the result evaluation, so the actual diagnostic, is performed during engine running. The re-
quired information about the TAM_SMT_NVLD sensor, that was present in the diagnostic mode, is gathered
when STATE_NVLD is in "READ_INI", so right after engine start. The bits that deliver the information about
these diagnostics are LV_SYM_TAM_SMT_RNG_H/L_NVLD and LV_TAM_SMT_PLAUS_NVLD.
More Explanations for each diagnostic symptom:
? TAM_SMT_RNG_H diagnostics is done on hot and cold start during STATE_NVLD = "TAM_SWI_DIAG"
? TAM_SMT_RNG_L (and TAM_SMT_CHK) are only done on cold start (LV_CST_DET_NVLD = 1) and if the
diagnostics for the TIA and TCO sensors are ?nished (LV_CDN_RNG_L = 1).
Also, the ambient temperatures shall not be too low to run the TAM_SMT_RNG_L evaluation (see if-
construct for LV_CDN_TCO_TIA_RNG_L_NVLD) as the lower temperature range limit of the TAM_SMT_
NVLD sensor is -40�C. So to avoid false TAM_SMT_RNG_L failure entries due to really low outside temper-
atures, the diagnostic should only run with a certain distance from -40�C. (This distance can be calibrated.
See pseudo code part below).
? TAM_SMT_PLAUS detects temperature drops of more than +/-20�C during diagnostic mode. Like men-
tioned before, a plausibility symptom is reported with LV_TAM_SMT_PLAUS_NVLD during "READ_INI".
The evaluation of the TAM_SMT_PLAUS is always done during hot start, when STATE_NVLD is in "TAM_
SWI_DIAG".
During cold start (LV_CST_DET_NVLD = 1) it is done if LV_CDN_RNG_L is set and if no error occurred for
TAM_SMT_RNG_L.
?

The evaluation of the TAM_SMT_PLAUS is always done during hot start, when STATE_NVLD is in "TAM_
SWI_DIAG".
During cold start (LV_CST_DET_NVLD = 1) it is done if LV_CDN_RNG_L is set and if no error occurred for
TAM_SMT_RNG_L.
? TAM_SMT_CHK diagnosis consists of a simple compare of different temperature sources (TIA, TCO) with
the TAM_SMT_NVLD value at engine cold start (LV_CST_DET_NVLD = 1).
Moreover, LV_CDN_RNG_L_NVLD has to be set and no errors must have been occurred on TAM_SMT_
RNG_L and TAM_SMT_PLAUS to enable the diagnostic.
